executive_summary.overview: Vistra Corp (VST US) is a leading integrated retail electricity and power generation company in the United States, with a dominant position in Texas's deregulated ERCOT market. The company operates approximately 41 GW of generation capacity across nuclear, natural gas, coal, and solar assets, serving over 5 million retail customers through brands including TXU Energy, Ambit Energy, and Dynegy. Vistra is uniquely positioned to benefit from the AI-driven data center power demand boom.
investment_highlights: Dominant integrated position in ERCOT (Texas) with ~18 GW generation capacity and leading retail market share
Irreplaceable 6.4 GW Comanche Peak nuclear asset providing zero-carbon baseload power
Data center power demand growth creating structural tailwind for dispatchable generation
Vertically integrated model provides natural hedge between generation and retail segments
Aggressive share repurchase program returning capital to shareholders
Strong free cash flow generation with improving balance sheet
key_risks: ERCOT market volatility and potential regulatory changes post-Winter Storm Uri
Natural gas price exposure affecting generation margins
Coal fleet phase-out execution and stranded asset risk
Nuclear operational risk and capital intensity
Competition from renewable energy and battery storage
Data center demand may not materialize as aggressively as expected

texas_ercot_market.description: ERCOT (Electric Reliability Council of Texas) operates as an energy-only wholesale market without capacity payments, covering ~90% of Texas electricity load
market_characteristics: Energy-only market with $5,000/MWh price cap (raised from $9,000 post-Uri)
No capacity market creates scarcity pricing opportunities
Rapid load growth from population migration and industrial expansion
Limited interconnection with other US grids
High renewable penetration (solar and wind) creating volatility
load_growth_drivers: Population growth: Texas gaining ~1,000 residents daily
Data center expansion: Austin, Dallas, Houston corridors

thesis.summary: Vistra Corp offers compelling exposure to the AI-driven data center power demand theme through its irreplaceable Comanche Peak nuclear asset and dominant ERCOT market position, with downside protection from the integrated retail business and aggressive share buyback program.
key_points: Data Center Thematic Play: Vistra's nuclear and gas fleet provides 24/7 dispatchable power essential for hyperscaler data centers, a theme with structural multi-year tailwinds
Irreplaceable Nuclear Asset: Comanche Peak's 6.4 GW cannot be replicated in Texas; hyperscalers increasingly willing to pay premium for carbon-free baseload
Integrated Model Stability: Generation-retail hedge reduces earnings volatility compared to pure merchant generators
Shareholder-Friendly Capital Allocation: Aggressive buybacks have reduced share count 20% at attractive prices; strong FCF supports continued returns
ERCOT Structural Tailwind: Texas population and economic growth driving sustained power demand increase
Attractive Valuation: Trading at 11.8x EV/EBITDA vs Constellation at 13.5x despite similar data center exposure potential
